moves.1. d4 e6 2. Bf4 Bb4+ 3. c3 Bd6: I decided here to play similarly to the previous annotation.
moves.5... Qe7: He black varies, but it works all the same.
moves.6... g6: Defending and providing me with some objectives.
moves.7. Nd2: Not easy to exploit, right now. So let's develop.
moves.7... h5 8. Ngf3: Black wants to expand, I have to stop it.
moves.8... f5: What a wall! Again, I struggle for a dsb.
moves.9... Nf6: Trying to find a good move, I wanted to try...
moves.10. Nh2: A similar theme to the previous game.
moves.10... fxe4 11. Nxe4 Nxe4 12. Qxe4: This allow Qg5, but in that case, Ng4! Nice, isn't it?
moves.13. Bd3: Attacking g6, but I don't want to exchange queens.
moves.13... Rf8: Well, now, if he does, he will lose two pawns, so....
moves.14. f3: Ah, first I have to shield f2, of course.
moves.15. Qxg6+ Qf7: Better than QxQ. A pity black lost a tempo with d5. Rg8 and I would have had work to do.
moves.16. Qg5: No queen's exchange. My queen won't be useless in this game.
moves.16... Rg8 17. Qh4: Same square, but what a difference!
moves.18. O-O-O Nc6 19. Rde1 Ne7: Same as the previous game. But now, with my knight in h2, it is really more annoying.
moves.20. g4 hxg4 21. Nxg4: The knight into the game, and the queen with squares to go.
moves.21... O-O-O: But black can castle. Here, I lost my temper and blundered.
moves.22. Nf6: Ne4 was the move, or go for f4, f5 at once. Not this.
moves.24. Qh3: covers f3, threats the rook, and threats Qxe6. High voltage game.
